page.title: 08Pets
page.content: Most people in this area own some sort of pet. The variety of pet can be split into 6 main groups. These are: Small Rodents; Rabbits and Guinea Pigs; Cats and Dogs; Birds; Fishes; Horses. When and if you do own a pet you need to look after it carefully. Out of 220 children there were 292 pets, mainly cats and dogs. A few people have gerbils, chickens, ducks, rats, cockateels, terrapins, toads, canaries, horses, hedgehogs and birds. All together there were 22 different species of pets.Some pets are quite expensive to buy and keep like horses, dogs, large birds, snakes, monkeys and reptiles. Others are cheaper like rodents, fish and cats. Some animals live for 1 year and others for 60. Some animals stay the same size, others do not. We have to choose a pet carefully.
